stimulusHtml:
Write the  findWinner  method, which simulates a race between two cars consisting of  numLaps  laps around a racetrack. Each car takes a different amount of time to complete each lap, which can be found using the  getLapTime  method in the  RaceCar  class. For example, calling  getLapTime(3)  on a  RaceCar  object will return the number of seconds it takes the car to complete lap 3 of the race.


The  findWinner  method returns a  String  indicating the outcome of the race, according to the following rules.

  • "Car 1 wins!"  is returned if  carOne  completes the race in fewer seconds than  carTwo.

  • "Car 2 wins!"  is returned if  carTwo  completes the race in fewer seconds than  carOne.

  • "Tie!"  is returned if the cars complete the race in the same amount of time.
     

Complete method  findWinner.  You must use  getLapTime  appropriately in order to receive full credit.

 

/**
 *  Simulates a race with numLaps laps and returns a String
 *  indicating the outcome, as described in part (a)
 *  Precondition: numLaps > 0
 */
public String findWinner(int numLaps)

features.html:
This question involves the  RaceCar  and  SimulateCarRace  classes, which are used to simulate a race between two race cars. Each race consists of one or more laps around a racetrack, starting with lap 1. Each lap consists of one complete trip around the racetrack.

 
The  RaceCar  class contains a helper method,  getLapTime.  You will write two methods in the  SimulateCarRace  class.

 

public class RaceCar
{
   /** 
    *  Returns the number of seconds it takes the race car
    *  to complete the lap specified by the parameter
    */
   public double getLapTime(int lapNum)
   { /* implementation not shown */ }
      
   /* There may be instance variables, constructors,
      and methods that are not shown. */
}

 

public class SimulateCarRace
{
   private RaceCar carOne;
   private RaceCar carTwo;

   /**
    *  Simulates a race with numLaps laps and returns a String 
    *  indicating the outcome, as described in part (a)
    *  Precondition: numLaps > 0
    */
   public String findWinner(int numLaps)
   { /* to be implemented in part (a) */}

   /**
    *  Returns a shortened version of the parameter message with all 
    *  substrings that are equal to the parameter str removed, as 
    *  described in part (b) 
    *  Precondition: There are no overlapping occurrences of str
    *                within message.
    */
   public String shortenMessage(String message, String str)
   { /* to be implemented in part (b) */}

   /* There may be instance variables, constructors, and methods 
      that are not shown. */
}
